lexUnit.name: pad.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk with steady steps making a soft, dull sound.

sentence.text: After a while he heard the others move , heard Rufus take a great slurp of wine before they padded barefoot into the house and up the stairs to the Centaur Room .
Throwing back the sheets he padded naked across to the bathroom .
He padded barefoot across the carpet and lifted the receiver .
I picked up my mug and padded barefoot into the lounge .
Two great cats , amber-eyed , with tufted ears and spotted skins of burnished gold , padded as soft as death across the polished floor .
She padded across to the window , drew back the curtains and looked out .
He got up again and padded across to Abigail 's room .
Donna got to her feet and padded across to the bathroom where she showered quickly , rinsing away the dirt of the journey .
Georg ignored them both and padded across to the table in his stockinged feet .
So insistent was the noise that she padded downstairs in her nightshirt and picked up the handset .
My brain went some way up through the gear-box next morning as I padded downstairs to collect my pint of gold top .
She undressed partly and padded about the perpetually shifting floor in stocking feet , suspenders , slip and bra .
Leaving Okawi and Beruna , Miles turned away from the village and padded silently across the beach to the tree line .
Slipping on a light cotton robe , she padded across the thick bedroom carpet , through the large living-room and into the kitchen .
Henry stood up and padded across the thick carpet to the window .
Barbara padded across the carpet to the en-suite bathroom and opened the medicine cabinet above the basin .
Neville rose from his seat and padded across the threadbare carpet to the whisky optic .
He got out of bed and padded across the carpet to his briefcase .
Would she ever again pad across the grass , barefoot in her bikini ?
Masklin got up and padded across the metal floor to the door .
Dillon padded heavily across the room to sink into a chair next to Tweed .
Her bare feet padded across the polished terracotta tiles to the bottles lined along a shelf in the corner .
Two huge gaolers , with the bodies of apes and the faces of cruel mastiffs , padded silently behind them .
On the southern side there is a tern colony , and the birds hover above our heads like noisy butterflies while we pad carefully between groups of their precious eggs .
The clouds were lifting and breaking and at dusk , as Erika padded home from her run in the park , the temperature was falling .
She padded into the galley .
The back screen door slammed and a second later her son Hank padded silently into the kitchen .
Barefoot , she padded into her cramped kitchen and took a can of Coke from the refrigerator .
Still trembling , she got out finally and wrapped herself in a huge towel and padded into the kitchen to put the kettle on .
Securing her hair in a black band , she padded silently into the warmth of the night and headed for the pool .
He turned to his right and padded softly over the familiar , uneven stone floor .
I padded past him , towards the bathroom .
There was complete silence as we padded through two more streets with walls so bitten away that they looked like lace .
I have not padded through the Taj Mahal ,
Groaning , Lindsey reached for her robe , padded to the bathroom and stuck her head under the cold shower .
He rose languidly from behind the desk and padded to the door .
Barefoot , he padded to her side , kneeling down unbearably close .
Liz closed her door without making a noise and padded toward the child .
Purring loudly , Cas padded towards her , tail erect , bright green eyes unblinking .
A lion padded towards them with shaggy gold mane and blood-stained jaws , came straight up to the car window .
Then my father slowly raised his rifle and there was the tiger , padding towards us along a narrow game trail , his head moving from side to side .
Viol abandoned his drink and padded after him , twenty yards behind .
Something heavy and barefoot was padding around the conservatory .
Then Philippa kicked off her sandals and started to pad around the room in bare feet .
She padded around until she located the kitchen .
Pike , on all fours , started to pad around the floor in search of the missing toupee .
She kisses me , then she 's out , slipping on the dressing-gown and padding away and clicking the door closed behind her .
Athelstan hoped he was safe and would come padding back when he was hungry , tail in the air , miaowing for food and comfort .
An unspoken sympathy bound them in comfortable silence as they padded down the garden .
` As I padded down the passage to the kitchen , I felt that something was wrong .
They padded down the backstairs .
I rolled out of the upper berth and padded down the corridor to the bathroom .
They padded down a series of passages that criss-crossed like a maze .
Padding out as silently as she came , she left me to the early morning quiet .
The cat leaped lightly on to the bed and padded over the bodiless sleeves .
With his head lowered , Vincent walked out and padded heavily up the stairs .
Here in the flat I take off my shoes and pad about in slippers because maybe I 'll find it calming .
A lone cat was padding almost invisibly along in the lee of a low wall .
Dinosaurs , too , walked on tip-toe ( i.e. they are known by paleontologists as being digitigrade ) whereas sprawlers pad along on their soles .
On the right and the left of my track , padding along in parallel silence were bears .
Tail wagging his thanks , he took the handle of the basket in his mouth and padded happily along beside Angela .
On the TV screen there 's a guy padding around in front of my block of flats , pointing out the scenery .
After a few minutes she padded back into the bedroom wrapped in a big fluffy towel .
Then she padded back into the bathroom , wriggled out of her nightie , and sank down into the hot water .
Lizzie was indignant and padded back to the kitchen mumbling to herself .
The cat had finished with its night hunt , and came padding silently back to its home territory .
He rose to his feet , padded silently back across the room and gently closed the bedroom door .
I shook my head , and she smiled and nodded and patted me on the shoulder and padded off to the kitchen .
I slid out of bed , put on my dressing-gown and padded out to the tiny landing .
He put on his cloak and padded over to the door .
I padded over towards him and looked up expectantly .
Jessamy eventually hauled herself out of bed and padded over to the window .
He pulled on his dressing gown and padded through into the sitting room .
Ilsa 's house was dark and we padded through to the back porch like conspirators .
We were walking up the road from the hotel when a young man padded up behind us and greeted us in English .
The phones ringing on each floor must have awakened Anna , for she could hear bare feet padding overhead .
